claim.text: changes in speech and language may be early markers of dementia
claim.exact_quote: There is growing evidence that changes in speech and language may be early markers of dementia

evidence.evidence_text: There is growing evidence that changes in speech and language may be early markers of dementia, but much of the previous NLP work in this area has been limited by the size of the available datasets.

claim.text: domain adaptation can augment a small French dataset with a much larger English dataset for dementia detection
claim.exact_quote: Here, we compare several methods of domain adaptation to augment a small French dataset of picture descriptions with a much larger English dataset

evidence.evidence_text: Here, we compare several methods of domain adaptation to augment a small French dataset of picture descriptions with a much larger English dataset, for the task of automatically distinguishing participants with dementia from controls.
evidence.limitations: The claim is specific to the methods used in this study and may not apply to other domain adaptation methods.
evidence.exact_quote: Here, we compare several methods of domain adaptation to augment a small French dataset of picture descriptions with a much larger English dataset, for the task of automatically distinguishing participants with dementia from controls.

evidence.evidence_text: The first challenge is to identify a set of features that transfer across languages; in addition to previously used features based on information units, we introduce a new set of features to model the order in which information units are produced by dementia patients and controls.
evidence.limitations: The claim is specific to the methods used in this study and may not apply to other domain adaptation methods.
evidence.exact_quote: The first challenge is to identify a set of features that transfer across languages; in addition to previously used features based on information units, we introduce a new set of features to model the order in which information units are produced by dementia patients and controls.

conclusion.key_limitations: Dependent on the identification of transferable features across languages

claim.text: the ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English
claim.exact_quote: The fact that the ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English has an added practical benefit

evidence.evidence_text: The fact that the ALL configuration is optimal in both French and English has an added practical benefit: since there is no distinction between source and target features, the resulting classifier is language-agnostic.

claim.text: the study shows that features can distinguish AD patients from healthy controls with high accuracy
claim.exact_quote: we have shown that there are features which can both distinguish AD patients from healthy controls with a high degree of accuracy

evidence.evidence_text: We have shown that there are features which can both distinguish AD patients from healthy controls with a high degree of accuracy, and also generalize across languages.
evidence.limitations: The claim is specific to the methods used in this study and may not apply to other feature sets or classification methods.
evidence.exact_quote: We have shown that there are features which can both distinguish AD patients from healthy controls with a high degree of accuracy, and also generalize across languages.

claim.text: the study developed a new set of features using concept-based language modelling
claim.exact_quote: we also developed a new set of features for this task, using concept-based language modelling

evidence.evidence_text: We also developed a new set of features for this task, using concept-based language modelling, which improved AUC from 0.80 to 0.85 in the unilingual case, and 0.88 to 0.89 in the multilingual case.
evidence.limitations: The claim is specific to the methods used in this study and may not apply to other feature sets or classification methods.

claim.text: the study suggests that similar techniques could be effective for detecting earlier stages of cognitive decline
claim.exact_quote: Future work will involve extending the set of features involved, incorporating data from other languages, and testing whether similar techniques can be effective for detecting earlier stages of cognitive decline

evidence.limitations: The claim is based on the future direction of the study and not on new experimental evidence presented in the paper.
